		<title>Pica Design Welcomes RHR Smith &amp; Company</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/12/pica-design-welcomes-rhr-smith-company/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Dec 2010 18:59:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Rob</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=932</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design is pleased to welcome RHR Smith &amp; Company, C.P.A.sÂ to our Client roster. In early November, RHR contracted us to provide Email Marketing services through Pica eNewsâ¢, a simple yet robust tool that allows RHR to create and deliver email campaigns on the fly. RHR Smith &amp; Company, C.P.A.s is a full service, Maine-based  accounting firm, which specializes in building client relationships. Their Development Services division offers consulting and other strategic  expertise to clients. Its staff includes a former executive director  with 20 years of experience in nonprofit management, and extensive  knowledge in business and governmental organizations.Â To learn more about RHR Smith &amp; Company, you can visit their website here: <a href="http://www.rhrsmith.com/" target="_blank">www.rhrsmith.com</a>. To learn more about our Email Marketing Service,Â Pica eNewsâ¢, visit: <a href="http://success.picadesign.com/eNews/index.php" target="_blank">success.picadesign.com/eNews</a>.

		<title>Pica Design Awarded WreathsAcrossAmerica.org Website Project</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2011/04/pica-design-awarded-wreathsacrossamerica-org-website-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Apr 2011 22:09:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Rob</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=945</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design is pleased to welcome Wreaths Across Americaâ¢, as a new Client. In early March, Pica was awarded a contract to provide web development services to redesign WAA's new website presence. The new website is currently in development. Wreaths Across Americaâ¢ is a non profit 501(c)(3) organization that was formed as an extension of the Arlington Wreath Project. The Arlington Wreath program was started by Morrill Worcester of Worcester WreathÂ CompanyÂ in 1992 with the donation and laying of 5,000 Christmas wreaths to Arlington National Cemetery. To learn more about Wreaths Across Americaâ¢ or support their organization, you can visit them at <a href="http://www.wreathsacrossamerica.org" target="_blank">www.wreathsacrossamerica.org</a>. To learn more about Pica Design's web development services, visit us at <a href="http://www.picadesign.com">www.picadesign.com</a> or give us a call.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>WCGH and Pica Design Build Campaign to Advertise Primary Care Providers in Waldo County </title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2011/06/wcgh-and-pica-design-build-campaign-to-advertise-primary-care-providers-in-waldo-county/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 30 Jun 2011 17:08:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jen</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=952</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Waldo County General Hospital recently launched a direct mail and advertising campaign to increase community awareness of health center services and the availability of primary care providers in Waldo County. "Quality Care, Close to Home" is the main message of the campaign. Health Center resources include priority sick visits, on-site lab work, friendly staff, and programs for qualifying patients that can help to pay for doctor visits and prescriptions.

Hospital staff managed the implementation of the campaign working closely with Pica Design on strategy, photography, copywriting and design. Local photographer, Margaret McKenna, provided the photography for the campaign, which ran in local online and print news channels. The new campaign ties into the hospital's new website (also developed by Pica Design), which helps track response to the new campaign.

Highlighted in the campaign were primary care doctors in Waldo County and the Hospitalâs physician referral service. The Health Centers featured include: Arthur Jewell Community Health Center, Donald S. Walker Health Center, Lincolnville Regional Health Center, Searsport Health Center, and Stockton Springs Regional Health Center. A second campaign focuses on the Hospitalâs Physical and Occupational Therapy programs. To view the Primary Care campaign artwork, visit: <a href="http://picadesign.com/index.php?option=com_joomgallery&amp;func=detail&amp;id=693&amp;Itemid=40">www.picadesign.com</a>.Â To learn more about the Hospital's service offerings, visit: <a href="http://qualitycare.wcgh.org/" target="_blank">www.wcgh.org</a>.

<a href="http://picadesign.com/index.php?option=com_joomgallery&amp;func=detail&amp;id=693&amp;Itemid=40"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-988" title="WCGH_QualityCare_Home_Slide" src="http://blog.picadesign.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/WCGH_QualityCare_Home_Slide.jpg" alt="" width="522" height="312" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica goes Abstract</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2011/06/pica-goes-abstract/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Jun 2011 21:50:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Micah</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=958</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[On a Friday in early June, the Pica Design team took a road trip to Portland to attend <a href="http://abstractconference.com/">Abstract Maine 2011</a>. The conference was hosted by <a href="http://maine.aiga.org/about/board_members">AIGA Maine</a> and their supporting sponsors. Abstract brought together six heavy hitters from the design community to talk about editorial design and its future (psst...it's digital): Florian Bachleda of <em>FastÂ  Company</em>, Dirk Barnett of <em>Newsweek</em>, Scott Dadich of CondÃ© Nast, Arem Duplessis of <em>The New York Times Magazines</em>, Luke Hayman of Pentagram and Gael Towey of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia.

We got an inside look at the process behind putting a <em>Newsweek</em> cover together;Â  staging a photo shoot with Conan Obrien; blow-drying Martha Stewart's Hens for a photo shoot; and rebranding the <em>New York Magazine</em> with Pentagram. More than that, we got an inside look at where the editorial world is heading and, yes, it has to do with the iPad and the tablet computer. We took a sneak preview at InDesign 5.5 with the good folks from Adobe and saw some of the digital tools they are building into future versions. Exciting stuff, to be sure.

Stepping outside of the daily goings- on around the office and listening to some great talks was both refreshing and inspiring.Â Overall, we brought home more ideas and inspiration than our brains could carry from some of the top professionals in our industry. The day was topped off by <a href="http://www.thefrontroomrestaurant.com/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=2&amp;Itemid=3">excellent food</a> and conversation in Portland's Old Port. Many thanks to <a href="http://maine.aiga.org/home">AIGA Maine</a> for putting together an excellent conference.

[nggallery id=2] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>pica-goes-abstract</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Web Design / Web Developer Internship</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2011/06/web-design-web-developer-internship/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Jun 2011 13:08:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jamesmehorter</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=977</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design, LLC is offering a web design / web developer internship in Belfast, Maine. We are looking for a college student inÂ NewÂ Media or Computer Science to join our team part-time for the summer. Non-college applicants will also be considered. Applicants should have basic experience with HTML and CSS; PHP and Javascript experienceÂ preferred, but notÂ necessary. Applicants should have a desire to learn andÂ acquireÂ experience building websites.

The internship is non-paid, though there may be opportunities to participate in billable projects and receive compensation. Interns who work well with the team and have a drive to learn will be considered for future full-time positions. This is a great opportunity to receive hands-on, real-world experience planning, designing, building, and managing small and large websites.

Pica Design is a design and marketing agency offering print design; interactive design and development; marketing strategy, and project management.

Qualified applicants may send a digital resume and portfolio to <a href="mailto:web@picadesign.com" target="_blank">web@picadesign.com</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica Design Accepts AIGA Challenge</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/05/pica-design-accepts-aiga-challenge/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 May 2009 21:52:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=167</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We're excited about the letter O.

We've accepted the challenge to make a 3-foot 'O' that will appear in the word 'SHOW' at the 2009 AIGA BoNE Show in Boston at Massachusetts College of Art in June. (By the way, BoNE stands for 'Best of New England', and it is the name of a regional design competition hosted by the Boston Chapter of the American Institute of Graphic Arts, or AIGA). The 3-foot-high, 43-foot-long Exhibition marquee of dimensional letters will spell out, 'AIGA B(oNE) SHOW' and will feature found or re-purposed materials. Each letter will be on display for the duration of the exhibition and will be up for auction at the Opening Reception on June 11 to raise money for AIGA Boston.

We have some ideas on materials we would like to use for our environmentally friendly letter O...do you? If you have a suggestion on materials, please leave a comment here (keep in mind the final O must be 25 pounds max).

O, what fun.

AIGA B(oNE) SHOW
Opening Reception: Jun 11
Exhibition: June 12 - July 8
Location: Bakalar Gallery, 621 Huntington Ave., Boston
<a href="http://www.boneshow.org">www.boneshow.org</a>

Thanks to Brandon Bird, AIGA BoNE SHOW Director
for sending us the Call for Characters!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>pica-design-accepts-aiga-challenge</wp:post_name>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Connect the Dots: The Results Show</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/05/connect-the-dots-the-results-show/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 22 May 2009 20:22:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=174</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong><span style="font-weight: normal;">Remember the <em>Connect the Dots</em> newsletter we sent out recently announcing the launch of our new website? We want to share with you some compelling results from that news blast.</span></strong>

<strong><span style="font-weight: normal;">
</span></strong>

<strong></strong>

[caption id="attachment_248" align="alignnone" width="423" caption="Graph charting open and click times for the first 12 hours after sending"]<strong><img class="size-full wp-image-248" title="Graph of the Open and Click times of the Email" src="http://www.picadesign.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2009/05/picture-5.png" alt="Graph charting open and click times " width="423" height="150" /></strong>[/caption]

<strong></strong>

<strong>The Best Part about Instant Communication is Instant Results!
</strong>

<strong></strong>

<strong></strong>

<strong></strong>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-weight: normal;"><em>Connect the Dots</em> was opened by 48% of recipients (this is called the 'open rate', and 48% is high; usual range is 10% - 50%)</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: normal;">visits to our website increased by 727% on the day we sent out our newsletter, and since then, our daily visits have doubled</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: normal;">the link to our blog was the most commonly clicked link in the email</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: normal;">28 emails on our subscriber list produced 'bounces' - these are often email accounts that no longer exist. Didn't get <em>Connect the Dots</em> but think you should have? Maybe your email was on that list! </span><span style="font-weight: normal;">Subscribe through the form in the sidebar t</span><span style="font-weight: normal;">o get back in-the-know on all things Pica. <strong>
</strong></span></li>
</ul>
<strong>The Nitty Gritty</strong>
<ul>
	<li>We sent the email to 284 subscribers</li>
	<li>The total cost to send the campaign was $12.84 - $10 plus 1 cent for every email contact</li>
</ul>
The system we use is amazing: it helps us to keep track of multiple lists of subscribers, it can schedule sending the email at a specific time--so you don't have to be awake to hit the 'send' button, and it'll provide an interactive chart of who opened the email when and which links they clicked (yes, you do occasionally feel like a marketing spy).

We're definitely inspired to start communicating with our clients more through email, to share new site launches, logo designs, and all around good branding sense. We've also created a new email blast just for those of you interested in receiving special offers and marketing tips - if you want to be on that list <a href="http://picadesign.com/pica-points.html" target="_self">sign up here!</a> Inspired like we are, and want to start an eNews campaign of your own? Check back Tuesday for details on the new Pica Design eNews Starter Package, and enter a contest to win one!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica eNEWS Contest</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/05/pica-enews-contest/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 26 May 2009 12:00:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=194</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Our eNEWS Starter Package</strong> is a great way to open the door to online marketing.Â We think this is great stuff, so we decided to launch a contest. The first 5 people to comment on this post (see the pink comments link below) will receive our $250 <strong>eNEWS Starter Package for FREE</strong>, and the next 10 people after that will get a 50% discount ($125 for the package). All you have to do is tell us your favorite piece of work in the Pica Portfolio, and why it's your choice.

Don't forget to leave us your (real) email address when you post your comment, so that we can get in touch and set up your first eNEWS letter.Â Thanks for listening!

<strong>Fine print:</strong> Contest entries accepted through May 31, 2009.Â Pica Design to set up an eNEWS account, set up one mailing list of email contacts, and design and develop an eNEWS template that the customer can edit and re-use indefinitely. Email contacts must be supplied by the customer in xls or csv (digital) format. Customer must have permission to use the email addresses on their contact list. Free eNEWS Starter Package winners pay the sending fee of $10 plus 1 cent for every email contact per campaign. Questions? <a href="http://mailto:info@picadesign.com">Contact us!</a>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>WebSmart Seminar Covers Basics &amp; Beyond</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/06/websmart-seminar-covers-basics-beyond/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Jun 2009 21:15:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=388</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We held a seminar for businesses last Thursday at Unity Centre for Performing Arts. Our attentive, inquisitive audience of business owners absorbed all sorts of information in a short 1.5-hour timeframe. It was a please-ask-questions-as-we-go format, and each of us (there were five Pica Design panelists) added in demonstrations and stories to activate the content with real-life examples of web stuff.

To begin, we covered how websites work (hosts, files, domain names, links, browsers), searching the web, and ways people use the web. We demonstrated the anatomy of a basic website, steps for building a website, and then delved into functionality and content management systems (CMS). We touched on elements of design, testing, maintenance, pre-launch marketing, and launch marketing. And, as we concluded, we talked about social networking. Once we started talking about Facebook and Twitter, we could have gone on and on...

With the support of UniTel and Unity College, we passed on some of the knowledge we have been gathering over the few years. We are already looking forward to our next seminar (we're hoping to conduct one in the fall). If you think of topics that would appeal and enlighten either business owners or individuals, please comment here. And, as always, thank you for listening!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>388</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-06-30 14:15:24</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-06-30 21:15:24</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>websmart-seminar-covers-basics-beyond</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="company-news"><![CDATA[Company News]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="event"><![CDATA[Event]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="social-networking"><![CDATA[Social Networking]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="websites"><![CDATA[Websites]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_aktt_hash_meta</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>aktt_notify_twitter</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[yes]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[3]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>

	<item>
		<title>Coulda, Woulda, Shoulda</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/07/coulda-woulda-shoulda/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jul 2009 19:54:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=479</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[How would you translate 'coulda, woulda, shoulda' into real words?

a) could of, would of, should of

OR

b) could have, would have, should have

If you chose b: could have, would have, should have, you are correct.Â 

<em>W</em><em>hy is that</em>?

It's something called the "third conditional", which is a verb form used to communicate an event in the past that didn't happen, such as: "If I hadn't already eaten so many vegetables, I would have finished the burrito."

It seems that there is some confusion surrounding this. The contraction of the two words 'could have' (could've) sounds a lot like 'could of'. But, 'could of' is not correct English. It doesn't mean anything (unless it's in some other sentence construction, such as: "I could, of course, finish the burrito tonight.")

Anyway, it's all the fault of V8 juice.

Remember the saying: "I could have had a V8'? It all started there. Willy nilly, they threw out a saying, and even though they said, "could've", it sounded <em>a lot </em>like "could of" and the rest is history.

By the way, did you know that V8 Vegetable Juice was invented by W.G. Peacock of Evanston, IL, Â in 1933? Campbell Soup Company acquired theÂ <em>V8</em>Â brand and secret recipe in 1948. They have been makingÂ V8 beverages ever since.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>479</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-07-28 12:54:06</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-07-28 19:54:06</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>coulda-woulda-shoulda</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="company-news"><![CDATA[Company News]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="fun"><![CDATA[Fun]]></category>
		<category domain="post_tag" nicename="grammar"><![CDATA[Grammar]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>_aktt_hash_meta</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key>aktt_notify_twitter</wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[yes]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>Hey Everyone</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/07/hey-everyone/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jul 2009 14:38:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=498</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hi, I'm James Mehorter, nice to meet you

I am new to Pica and absolutely love it here! I was asked to introduce myself on this here blog so here goes it! I'm a Leo and I enjoy long sensual walks on the beach...

Pshhh, yeah right, I'm Irish, so the sun and I are fighting every day. Beaches are kind of out of the question. But you don't want to hear that, you want to hear the juicy details on who I am don't you! I am 27 and just graduated from the University of Maine at Orono, majoring in Studio Art, Art History, and New Media. My plan was to stay there forever, keeping my loans in a constant state of deferment, but Rob was nice enough to hire me.

My work ranges from traditional printmaking and sculpture, to digital 3d animation, to large interactive website development.

When I'm not working you might find me cruising on my motorcycle, playing the bass guitar, or sitting at the Sugarloaf summit contemplating the meaning of life and which condiments I'll choose for my burger.

Thanks Pica!

James out -]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica Establishes TxtResponsibly.org</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/08/pica-establishes-txtresponsibly-org/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2009 15:52:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=575</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[TxtResponsibly.org (the idea and the website) was created by the staff at Pica Design. Hearing news stories about the dangers of texting while driving, the statistics started to sink in: a distracted driver is <em>23 times more likely to cause a car accident</em> than an undistracted driver, according to the recent VirginiaTech Transportation Institute Study. To put this into a more familiar context, drunk drivers are <em>7 times</em> more likely to cause a car accident than sober drivers. The mission of the organization is to raise awareness of the dangers of texting while driving and to prevent harmful injury or death caused by the act of texting recklessly. Would you take the oath? Visit <a style="color: #ff5500; text-decoration: none;" href="http://picadesignllc.cmail1.com/t/y/l/kylyyu/l/d"> www.txtresponsibly.org</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>575</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-08-25 08:52:35</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-08-25 15:52:35</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>pica-establishes-txtresponsibly-org</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

	<item>
		<title>Mainely Pottery and Bluestreak Go Live with Revamped Websites</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/08/mainely-pottery-and-bluestreak-go-live-with-revamped-websites/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2009 15:53:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=577</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We frequently re-design or update existing websites that no longer serve their purpose. From upgrading a website with a new CMS (content management system) to quick image and text updates, we can spiff up a site in short order. We just finished two such updates: Mainely Pottery (an upgrade from a brochure-type site to a more functional, manageable site) and Bluestreak (a straightforward update). Visit <a style="color: #ff5500; text-decoration: none;" href="http://picadesignllc.cmail1.com/t/y/l/kylyyu/l/h">www.mainelypottery.com</a> or <a style="color: #ff5500; text-decoration: none;" href="http://picadesignllc.cmail1.com/t/y/l/kylyyu/l/k">www.bluestreakme.com</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>mainely-pottery-and-bluestreak-go-live-with-revamped-websites</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>WebSmart Seminar Wrap-Up</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/08/websmart-seminar-wrap-up/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2009 15:55:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=579</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our seminar on websites for businesses at Unity Center for the Performing Arts (June 25th) was well received. With five Pica people contributing to the content, we were able to share a broad range of information--from basic website structure and set-up, to CMS and social networking. We left our audience with one message: use us as a resource! Call, write or comment on our <a style="color: #ff5500; text-decoration: none;" href="http://picadesignllc.cmail1.com/t/y/l/kylyyu/l/u">blog</a>. We want to hear from you.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica Design at CMCA Thursday: Websites (that work!) for Artists</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/08/pica-design-at-cmca-thursday-august-27-2009/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 25 Aug 2009 16:54:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=584</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; line-height: 16.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #333333;"></p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; line-height: 16.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #333333;">Pica Design will participate in a panel discussion at CMCA to demonstrate Websites (that work!) for Artists at the CMCA Event: Making Connections: Monthly Marketing Series for Artists this Thursday. Join us from 7:00 - 8:30 PM for Websites, Blogs, Facebook, Twitter, e-marketing, organizational websites for artists, and more. Contact CMCA for registration or questions: 207-236-2875 x303.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Business After Hours at Pica Design</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/11/business-after-hours/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 19 Nov 2009 16:39:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.picadesign.com/blog/?p=602</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Come on down to Pica Design for the Belfast Chamber of Commerce Business after hours!

We will be opening our doors for the public to come see our studio and meet our great team.

<strong>Thursday, November 19, 2009 from 5:00pm to 7:00pm</strong>
<p style="text-align: left;"><strong>111 Church Street, Belfast, ME 04915</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Guests will be entered into a drawing for a custom eNEWS promotional package ($275.00 value). Enter the drawing for a chance to win!</p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="http://belfastmaine.org/members/businessAfterHours.cfm">Chamber of Commerce</a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="http://blog.picadesign.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/09-259_AfterHoursInvite_single.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-616 alignleft" title="09-259_AfterHoursInvite_single" src="http://blog.picadesign.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/09-259_AfterHoursInvite_single.jpg" alt="09-259_AfterHoursInvite_single" width="306" height="396" /></a></p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>VMD Studio</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2009/12/vmd-studio/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Dec 2009 19:19:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are proud to announce the release of an update to the VMD Studio website. 

Check it out - <a href="http://www.vmdstudio.com/" title="VM Design Studio" target="_blank">http://www.vmdstudio.com/</a>

VMD had Pica Design make the site look a little sleeker and more modernistic. We also built them a custom Joomla Module to manage/display all their projects and press releases. Another feature added was the homepage sideshow.  

Like your website but want to implement some new features? Send us an email to web@picadesign.com]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Burgess &amp; Burgess</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/01/burgess-burgess/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Jan 2010 22:34:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=645</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design is happy to announce the release of the Burgess &amp; Burgess website. Check it out!<a title="Burgess &amp; Burgess Website" href="http://www.burgessbilt.com"></a>
<h3><a title="Burgess &amp; Burgess Website" href="http://www.burgessbilt.com" target="_blank">http://www.burgessbilt.com</a></h3>
Jason and Kristian came to us with the desire to have a new website created for their construction business. We worked with their current branding and created a design they loved. They also hired <a href="mailto: water@midcoast.com">Donny Mullen</a> for the photography, which as you can see, is quite exquisite! Give us a call or shoot us an email if your business could use something similar! 207-338-1740 or <a href="mailto: web@picadesign.com">web@picadesign.com</a>

-Team Pica]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Google to phase out IE6 support</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/02/google-to-phase-out-ie6-support/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Feb 2010 15:17:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=653</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are very excited about Google's recent choice to phase out support for older web browsers. As web developers we pride ourselves in following modern <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/" title="Web Coding Practices and Standards" target="_blank">coding standards</a> set forth by the <a href="http://www.w3.org/" title="World Wide Web Consortium" target="_blank">W3C</a>. In order for developers to make sites look and work as desired in these older browsers we have to write in several coding 'hacks'. They are ugly and force us to not always follow the W3C standards. Google's role in this evolution for web development is quite critical. As industry leaders, their stance in forward thinking makes the world a better place... Thanks Google! At Pica Design we have already phased out IE6 support, and greatly encourage web users to keep their <a href="http://picadesign.com/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=26&amp;itemid=54" title="Pica Design Site Requirements" target="_blank">web browsers upgraded</a>. It's free, keeps you secure, and makes sites look as their designers planned for you to see them. - Team Pica
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sci/2010-02/01/c_13159200.htm" title="Google to Phase out IE6 Article" target="_blank"><img class="aligncenter" title="Google Catipilier Logo" src="http://rootsandrings.files.wordpress.com/2009/03/google-caterpillar-logo.jpg" alt="Google Logo" width="228" height="111" /></a></p>

<blockquote>"In order to continue to improve our products and deliver more sophisticated features and performance, we are harnessing some of the latest improvements in web browser technology. Â This includes faster JavaScript processing and new standards like HTML5. Â As a result, over the course of 2010, we will be phasing out support for Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 as well as other older browsers that are not supported by their own manufacturers.

We plan to begin phasing out support of these older browsers on the Google Docs suite and the Google Sites editor on March 1, 2010. Â After that point, certain functionality within these applications may have higher latency and may not work correctly in these older browsers. Later in 2010, we will start to phase out support for these browsers for Google Mail and Google Calendar.

Google Apps will continue to support Internet Explorer 7.0 and above, Firefox 3.0 and above, Google Chrome 4.0 and above, and Safari 3.0 and above.

Starting this week, users on these older browsers will see a message in Google Docs and the Google Sites editor explaining this change and asking them to upgrade their browser. Â We will also alert you again closer to March 1 to remind you of this change."Â  - The Google App Team</blockquote>
<a href="http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sci/2010-02/01/c_13159200.htm" title="Google to Phase out IE6" target="_blank">Read the Full Article</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>google-to-phase-out-ie6-support</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

			<wp:comment_author_url>http://www.7mdesign.com</wp:comment_author_url>
			<wp:comment_author_IP>216.195.184.219</wp:comment_author_IP>
			<wp:comment_date>2010-04-13 07:21:55</wp:comment_date>
			<wp:comment_date_gmt>2010-04-13 14:21:55</wp:comment_date_gmt>
			<wp:comment_content><![CDATA[Hi Candance,

Glad you enjoyed the article! We are so happy that along with Google; YouTube, Yahoo and Flickr, Campaign Monitor, and the folks from BaseCamp have all begun phasing out IE6 support! I am constantly blown away by the number of folks using Internet Explorer and Outlook. Both apps have massive security vulnerabilities - and the developers behind them don't seem to care at all about following web standards for IE and HTML Email standards for Outlook. It's only a matter of time before us designers / developers can actually spend our days ... designing and developing.. and not writing hacks to make our stuff work for IE and Outlook.  

James]]></wp:comment_content>
			<wp:comment_approved>post-trashed</wp:comment_approved>
			<wp:comment_type></wp:comment_type>
			<wp:comment_parent>0</wp:comment_parent>
			<wp:comment_user_id>9</wp:comment_user_id>
		</wp:comment>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>New French &amp; Webb website!</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/02/new-french-webb-website/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 08 Feb 2010 15:25:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=658</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design is proud to announce the release of a new website for French &amp; Webb boat builders in Belfast, ME.  Todd French and Peter Webb started French &amp; Webb, Inc. in 1996. Since then their company has gained a reputation for high standards and precision joinery. Located on the waterfront in Belfast, Maine, French &amp; Webb, Inc. builds wooden boats using modern methods in combination with traditional craftsmanship. The result is unparalleled workmanship and boats of the highest quality.

Todd and Peter came to us with a desire to update their web presence with a content-rich and stylized design which they can edit themselves. Are you looking to give your website a face lift? Contact Pica Design by email <a href="mailto: web@picadesign.com">web@picadesign.com</a> or phone 207-338-1740 to find out what we can do for you!

Check out the new site!
<h3><a href="http://www.frenchwebb.com " title="French & Webb Boat Builders" target="_blank">http://www.frenchwebb.com </a></h3>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica Wordpress Themes</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/pica-wordpress-themes/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 16:04:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=667</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here at Pica Design we are always looking to innovate and help other businesses meet their marketing goals. We truly believe all successful businesses should have a strong web presence in order to meet these goals. The cornerstone of a web presence obviously begins with a strong website which successfully communicates the business to their audience. Most large companies can easily afford such a presence, but what are small businesses to do without breaking the bank?

Here at Pica we have found a middle-ground; branded Wordpress themes. These themes let us reuse the common website framing used for most websites; similar to a house foundation, then style the exterior with client branding and colors. We also have modularized several common website components like a calendar, sideshows, image galleries, and blogs so clients can pick and choose the tools their website will need. Once a client chooses a template layout which matches their business model; we customize the template with the client branding and color scheme. We then bundle hosting / domain support and SEO into these packages.

So far we've had great success using these themes to create <a href="http://www.belfastmaskers.com/" target="_blank">The Belfast Maskers</a> website and the <a href="http://www.bjsautod.com/" target="_blank">BJ's Automotive</a> website.

Contact us to learn how these pre-packaged themes can help your business! 207-338-1470 | <a href="mailto: web@picadesign.com?subject=Inquiry: Pre-Packaged Web Themes">web@picadesign.com</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>667</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>The Belfast Maskers - New Website</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/the-belfast-maskers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 16:05:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=669</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Pica Design is happy to announce our sponsorship of The Belfast Maskers with a new website! All of us here love the Maskers and all the great plays / readings they perform for the public here in Belfast, Maine. So what better way to show our appreciation than by donating something we create daily.. a website! The site has image slideshows, an event calendar, and a news blog. The Maskers are also able to edit / manage all the content on their new website by themselves.

But, how did we do it without breaking the budget? Well, we've created a series of <a href="http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/pica-wordpress-themes/">customized Wordpress themes</a>, which allow us to create a branded web presence for our small business clients. Pretty cool huh?

Check out The Belfast Maskers new website! <a href="http://www.belfastmaskers.com/" target="_blank">http://www.belfastmaskers.com/</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>BJ&#039;s Automotive - New Website</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/bjs-automotive-new-website/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 16:23:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=677</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are happy to announce a new website for BJ's Automotive and Diagnostic Center. After our initial meeting with owner / operator Joel Knight, we all decided that our basic <a href="http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/pica-wordpress-themes/">pre-packaged Wordpress theme</a> was the best fit for his needs. Joel's main priority was to be one of the first small businesses in Belfast, Maine to have a website and be involved with social networking. Add <a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/BJs-Automotive/224521401686" target="_blank">BJ's on Facebook</a> and stay up-to-date with local automotive deals!

Check out the new BJ's Automotive website! <a href="http://www.bjsautod.com/" target="_blank">http://www.bjsautod.com/</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Landworks Waterfront - Website Update</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/landworks-waterfront-new-website/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 16:34:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=679</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The owners of Landworks Waterfront came to us with a request to update their old website. They were completely happy with the design / functionality of their old website; however, they wanted to add the ability to update the site themselves and, in particular, manage their SEO (Search Engine Optimization) internally. We created a custom Wordpress theme for them while keeping the design / layout / colors exactly the same.

Check out the updated Landworks Waterfront website! <a href="http://www.landworkswaterfront.com/" target="_blank">http://www.landworkswaterfront.com/</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>679</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-04-13 09:34:50</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-04-13 16:34:50</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>landworks-waterfront-new-website</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="company-news"><![CDATA[Company News]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="design"><![CDATA[Design]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="pica-client"><![CDATA[Pica Client]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Maine Windjammer - Media Community</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/maine-windjammer-media-community/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 22 Apr 2010 17:25:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=698</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here at Pica we just love trying new things; especially working with cool code libraries and open APIs (Application Programming Interface). The folks from the Maine Windjammer Association came back to us (we originally designed their site in '05) to incorporate a user-driven media community into their website. Well what does that mean? We used the <a href="http://code.google.com/apis/youtube/overview.html">YouTube API</a> and <a href="http://www.flickr.com/services/api/">Flickr API</a> to build tools for users to submit their photos and videos to the website. Now users can add video of their journey on the ships to the Windjammer YouTube user playlist, and add their photos to the Windjammer Flickr group . Users can also now submit their photos to a yearly Windjammer photo contest and possibly win a free Windjammer cruise! Check out the 'Image Gallery' and 'Video Gallery' on the new site!

<a href="http://www.sailmainecoast.com">http://www.sailmainecoast.com</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>698</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-04-22 10:25:44</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-04-22 17:25:44</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>maine-windjammer-media-community</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="company-news"><![CDATA[Company News]]></category>
		<category domain="category" nicename="pica-client"><![CDATA[Pica Client]]></category>

	<item>
		<title>Home Energy Solutions - New Website / Identity / Collateral</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/05/home-energy-solutions-new-website-identity-collateral/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 11 May 2010 13:27:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=704</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We are happy to announce the release of a new website for <a href="http://www.homeenergysolutions.biz/">Home Energy Solutions</a> out of Northport, ME. The folks there came to us looking to revamp their website, but they were on a budget. We suggested one of our <a href="http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/pica-wordpress-themes/">Pica Pre-Packaged websites</a> for small businesses.

We then themed the new website to match the identity and business cards we also created for them:

Let us know if you need a face-lift for your business! <a href="mailto: info@picadesign.com">info@picadesign.com</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>The HIP Women&#039;s Forum</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/07/website-heidelberg-international-professional-womens-forum/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Jul 2010 18:33:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=745</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We recently created a new website for the <a href="http://hipwf.com/" target="_blank">Heidelberg International Professional Women's Forum</a> (HIPWF) based in Heidelberg, Germany.Â The HIP Womenâs Forum was founded in 2007 with the vision of bringing together women of the Rhein Neckar region who share international backgrounds and professions in order to build a platform for professional development and a network to promote the individual and collective potential of each member.Â Women working for multinational companies abroad or in an international environment face many of the same challenges related to being a female professional in a foreign country. Through this forum, women can help one another to grow and achieve personal and professional success. To help them achieve this objective, the HIP Womenâs Forum provides a full program of events for professional networking and leadership education throughout the year.

After approaching us in the fall of 2009, the folks at HIPWF decided to go with one of ourÂ <a href="http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/04/pica-wordpress-themes/">Pre-Packaged Website</a> solutionsÂ to bring their start-up organization online at an affordable price. With the new website, HIPWF now has the right tools and know-how to manage their website's content virtually and internationally! If you're interested in learning how Pica Design's website development solutions can help your start-up business or organization succeed, shoot us an email at:Â <a href="mailto:info@picadesign.com">info@picadesign.com</a>

Check out the new website! <a href="http://hipwf.com/" target="_blank">http://hipwf.com/</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Cornerspring Montessori Website Launch</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/07/website-cornerspring-montessori/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Jul 2010 18:41:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=749</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We're pleased to announce the launch of the newÂ <a href="http://cornerspringmontessori.com/" target="_blank">Cornerspring MontessoriÂ SchoolÂ website</a>. If you're unfamiliar with Cornerspring Montessori School, they provide excellent child education programs in the heart of Belfast, Maine. <a href="http://www.cornerspringmontessori.com" target="_blank">Cornerspring Montessori School</a> strives to provide programs using a modified approach to the methods, philosophy, and teachings of Maria Montessori. Their goal is to provide an environment that will stimulate, foster and nurture the love for learning that will continue to develop throughout life. Their new website features a blog for teachers to share information with parents in real-time, a school calendar to promote upcoming events and program scheduling and ways for donors to support the school. It was a sincere pleasure to work with the folks from Cornerspring MontessoriÂ and a hoot to see this family-fun website come to fruition. If you would like to learn more about how we may be able to help your school or organization grow and prosper, contact us at:Â <a href="mailto:info@picadesign.com">info@picadesign.com</a>

Check out the website! <a href="http://www.cornerspringmontessori.com" target="_blank">http://www.cornerspringmontessori.com</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Pica Design Awarded Town of Camden Specialty Website Contract</title>
		<link>http://blog.picadesign.com/2010/08/pica-design-awarded-town-of-camden-specialty-website-contract/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Aug 2010 20:22:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://blog.picadesign.com/?p=769</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We would like to welcome the Town of Camden as a new client. In June, Pica Design responded to the Town of Camden and KWRED's (Knox/Waldo Regional Economic Development) Request For Proposals (RFP) to develop a specialty website and won the contract. The site's goal will be to market a town-owned property for redevelopment (the former Apollo Tannery site). Pica Design was chosen to design and program the website, www.freelandinmaine.org, which will be going live soon. Stay tuned!

To learn more about Pica Designâs website design, programming, SEO optimization and social media services, contact us today at info@picadesign.com.]]></content:encoded>
